message.content:
<<<api>>>: PrintWriter.write
<<<code>>>: 
import java.util.Scanner;
import java.io.PrintWriter;
import java.io.File;
import java.io.FileNotFoundException;

public class BenefieldProgram4 {
    public static void main(String[] args) {
        Scanner keyboard = new Scanner(System.in);
        System.out.println("Enter 5 Grades:");
        System.out.println("");
        
        double a, b, c, d, e; // 5 Grades
        double sum = 0; // total
        double avg; // percentage
        double min = 100; // lowest grade
        double max = 0; // highest grade
        
        // Input grades
        a = keyboard.nextDouble();
        b = keyboard.nextDouble();
        c = keyboard.nextDouble();
        d = keyboard.nextDouble();
        e = keyboard.nextDouble();
        keyboard.close();
        
        // Calculate total
        sum = a + b + c + d + e;
        System.out.println("Total Score: " + sum);
        
        // Calculate average
        avg = sum / 5;
        System.out.println("Percentage: " + avg);
        
        // Find highest and lowest grades
        if (a > max) {
            max = a;
        }
        if (b > max) {
            max = b;
        }
        if (c > max) {
            max = c;
        }
        if (d > max) {
            max = d;
        }
        if (e > max) {
            max = e;
        }
        System.out.println("Highest Score: " + max);
        
        if (a < min) {
            min = a;
        }
        if (b < min) {
            min = b;
        }
        if (c < min) {
            min = c;
        }
        if (d < min) {
            min = d;
        }
        if (e < min) {
            min = e;
        }
        System.out.println("Lowest Score: " + min);
        
        // Calculate grade
        String grade;
        if (avg >= 90) {
            grade = "A";
        } else if (avg >= 80) {
            grade = "B";
        } else if (avg >= 70) {
            grade = "C";
        } else if (avg >= 60) {
            grade = "D";
        } else {
            grade = "F";
        }
        System.out.println("Grade: " + grade);
        
        // Write results to a text file
        try {
            PrintWriter writer = new PrintWriter(new File("results.txt"));
            writer.write("Total Score: " + sum + "\n");
            writer.write("Percentage: " + avg + "\n");
            writer.write("Highest Score: " + max + "\n");
            writer.write("Lowest Score: " + min + "\n");
            writer.write("Grade: " + grade + "\n");
            writer.close();
            System.out.println("Results written to results.txt");
        } catch (FileNotFoundException e) {
            System.out.println("Error writing to file");
        }
    }
}

<<<explanation>>>: 
1. The code uses the PrintWriter class to write the results to a text file.
2. It creates a new PrintWriter object and specifies the file name "results.txt" in the constructor.
3. The write() method is used to write the results to the file.
4. The results are written in the desired format using string concatenation.
5. After writing the results, the PrintWriter is closed to ensure that the changes are saved.
6. If there is an error writing to the file, a FileNotFoundException is caught and an error message is displayed.
